name: UnionArgonaut Immunization ProfileAndUSCoreImmunizationProfile
title: Union of null And US Core Immunization Profile

element.short: left: Argonaut Immunization Profile; right: Immunization event information
element.definition: left: Describes the event of a patient being administered a vaccination or a record of a vaccination as reported by a patient, a clinician or another party and may include vaccine reaction information and what vaccination protocol was followed.; right: \-

constraint.human: If immunization was administered (wasNotGiven=false) then explanation.reasonNotGiven SHALL be absent.
If immunization was not administred (wasNotGiven=true) then there SHALL be no reaction nor explanation.reason present

element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comment: left: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation. Bundles always have an id, though it is usually a generated UUID.; right: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

element.definition: left: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource.; right: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: left: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content.; right: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
element.comment: left: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element as much as possible.; right: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comment: left: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource  Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).; right: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: left: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.; right: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comment: left: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.; right: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comment: left: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.; right: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags In their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.

element.definition:
left: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. element.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this immunization record.

element.short: left: in-progress | on-hold | completed | entered-in-error | stopped; right: completed | entered-in-error | not-done
element.definition: left: Indicates the current status of the vaccination event.; right: Indicates the current status of the immunization event.
element.comment: left: Will generally be set to show that the immunization has been completed.; right: Will generally be set to show that the immunization has been completed or not done.  This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

element.definition: Date vaccine administered or was to be administered.
element.comment: When immunizations are given a specific date and time should always be known.   When immunizations are patient reported, a specific date might not be known.  Although partial dates are allowed, an adult patient might not be able to recall the year a childhood immunization was given.

element.definition: Vaccine that was administered or was to be administered.

constraint.human: SHOULD have a translation to the to the NDC value set

element.definition: The patient who either received or did not receive the immunization.

element.short: Flag for whether immunization was given
element.definition: Indicates if the vaccination was or was not given.
element.isModifierReason: No Modifier Reason provideed in previous versions of FHIR

element.definition: True if this administration was reported rather than directly administered.
element.comment: May need source of reported info (e.g. parent), but leave out for now.

element.short: left: Who administered vaccine; right: Who performed event
element.definition: left: Clinician who administered the vaccine.; right: Indicates who performed the immunization event.

element.short: What type of performance was done
element.definition: Describes the type of performance (e.g. ordering provider, administering provider, etc.).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The role a practitioner or organization plays in the immunization event.

element.short: Individual or organization who was performing
element.definition: The practitioner or organization who performed the action.
element.comment: When the individual practitioner who performed the action is known, it is best to send.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Clinician who ordered the vaccination.
element.comment: Other participants - delegate to Provenance resource.

element.short: left: Encounter administered as part of; right: Encounter immunization was part of
element.definition: The visit or admission or other contact between patient and health care provider the immunization was performed as part of.
Name of vaccine manufacturer.

element.short: left: Where vaccination occurred; right: Where immunization occurred
element.definition: The service delivery location where the vaccine administration occurred.

mapping.map: RXA-27  (or RXA-11, deprecated as of v2.7)

element.definition: Lot number of the  vaccine product.
Date vaccine batch expires.
Body site where vaccine was administered.

binding.description: left: The site at which the vaccine was administered; right: The site at which the vaccine was administered.

element.definition: The path by which the vaccine product is taken into the body.

binding.description: left: The route by which the vaccine was administered; right: The route by which the vaccine was administered.

element.definition: The quantity of vaccine product that was administered.

element.short: left: Vaccination notes; right: Additional immunization notes
element.definition: Extra information about the immunization that is not conveyed by the other attributes.
Reasons why a vaccine was or was not administered.

element.short: Details of a reaction that follows immunization
element.definition: Categorical data indicating that an adverse event is associated in time to an immunization.
element.comment: left: A reaction may be an indication of an allergy or intolerance and, if this is determined to be the case,  it should be recorded as a new [[[AllergyIntolerance]]] resource instance as most systems will not query against  past Immunization.reaction elements.; right: A reaction may be an indication of an allergy or intolerance and, if this is determined to be the case, it should be recorded as a new AllergyIntolerance resource instance as most systems will not query against past Immunization.reaction elements.

element.definition: Date of reaction to the immunization.

mapping.map: OBX-14 (ideally this would be reported in an IAM segment, but IAM is not part of the HL7 v2 VXU message - most likely would appear in OBX segments if at all)

element.definition: Details of the reaction.
Self-reported indicator.

mapping.map: (no such concept seems to exist for allergy/adverse reaction in HL7 v2)
(HL7 v2 doesn't seem to provide for this)

element.definition: Contains information about the protocol(s) under which the vaccine was administered.

mapping.map: (HL7 v2 doesn't seem to provide for this)

element.definition: Indicates the reason the immunization event was not performed.
element.comment: This is generally only used for the status of "not-done". The reason for performing the immunization event is captured in reasonCode, not here.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Date vaccine administered or was to be administered.
element.comment: When immunizations are given a specific date and time should always be known.   When immunizations are patient reported, a specific date might not be known.  Although partial dates are allowed, an adult patient might not be able to recall the year a childhood immunization was given. An exact date is always preferable, but the use of the String data type is acceptable when an exact date is not known. A small number of vaccines (e.g. live oral typhoid vaccine) are given as a series of patient self-administered dose over a span of time. In cases like this, often, only the first dose (typically a provider supervised dose) is recorded with the occurrence indicating the date/time of the first dose.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: When the immunization was first captured in the subject's record
element.definition: The date the occurrence of the immunization was first captured in the record - potentially significantly after the occurrence of the event.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Indicates context the data was recorded in
element.definition: Indicates whether the data contained in the resource was captured by the individual/organization which was responsible for the administration of the vaccine rather than as 'secondary reported' data  documented by a third party. A value of 'true' means this data originated with the individual/organization which was responsible for the administration of the vaccine.
element.comment: This updated definition is adopted from the FHIR R5 Immunization resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Indicates the source of a secondarily reported record
element.definition: The source of the data when the report of the immunization event is not based on information from the person who administered the vaccine.
element.comment: Should not be populated if primarySource = True, not required even if primarySource = False.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The source of the data for a record which is not from a primary source.

mapping.map: .participation[typeCode=INF].role[classCode=PAT] (this syntax for self-reported) .participation[typeCode=INF].role[classCode=LIC] (this syntax for health care professional) .participation[typeCode=INF].role[classCode=PRS] (this syntax for family member)

element.definition: Reasons why the vaccine was administered.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The reason why a vaccine was administered.

element.definition: Condition, Observation or DiagnosticReport that supports why the immunization was administered.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Indication if a dose is considered to be subpotent. By default, a dose should be considered to be potent.
element.comment: Typically, the recognition of the dose being sub-potent is retrospective, after the administration (ex. notification of a manufacturer recall after administration). However, in the case of a partial administration (the patient moves unexpectedly and only some of the dose is actually administered), subpotency may be recognized immediately, but it is still important to record the event.
element.meaningWhenMissing: By default, a dose should be considered to be potent.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because an immunization event with a subpotent vaccine doesn't protect the patient the same way as a potent dose.

element.definition: Reason why a dose is considered to be subpotent.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The reason why a dose is considered to be subpotent.

element.definition: Educational material presented to the patient (or guardian) at the time of vaccine administration.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
One of documentType or reference SHALL be present

element.short: Patient eligibility for a vaccination program
element.definition: Indicates a patient's eligibility for a funding program.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The patient's eligibility for a vaccation program.

element.definition: Indicates the source of the vaccine actually administered. This may be different than the patient eligibility (e.g. the patient may be eligible for a publically purchased vaccine but due to inventory issues, vaccine purchased with private funds was actually administered).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The source of funding used to purchase the vaccine administered.

element.definition: The protocol (set of recommendations) being followed by the provider who administered the dose.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
